import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default ({components, ...props}) => <MDXTag name="wrapper"  components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"why-not-views"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h1" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#why-not-views"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Why not Views?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"i-use-different-target-platform"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#i-use-different-target-platform"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`I use different target platform`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Views morphs to React and React Native. If you use Vue, Angular, or any other
front-end library that Views doesn't currently morph to you will have to write
new morpher, and we can guide you through the process.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"i-need-more-integration-with-my-current-code-editor"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#i-need-more-integration-with-my-current-code-editor"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`I need more integration with my current code editor`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The current level of integration in the code editors stops at syntax highlighting
for Views language.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`You can contribute to linting for Views `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://github.com/viewstools/morph/issues/19"}}>{`Contribute here`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Your logic files will work with your current linting tools, because they are Javascript.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"i-want-to-use-views-tools-for-react-native-app"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#i-want-to-use-views-tools-for-react-native-app"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`I want to use Views Tools for React Native app`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The morphing process is not yet 100% accurate between React Web and React Native,
and results in some discrepancies between what you see in the Tools and in the app running
on a real device, or iOS simulator. `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://github.com/viewstools/morph/issues/47"}}>{`Contribute here`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"i-want-to-mix-logic-and-interface-styling-in-the-same-component"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#i-want-to-mix-logic-and-interface-styling-in-the-same-component"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`I want to mix logic and interface styling in the same component`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Views has a specific pattern to separate logic from interface composition.
We do that because the interface changes more often than the logic. That means,
once the `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`slots`}</MDXTag>{` (props) contract is set, the changes in design are decoupled from the logic,
and both teams can work in parallel.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"my-designers-want-to-control-animations"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#my-designers-want-to-control-animations"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag><MDXTag name="del" components={components} parentName="h2">{`My designers want to control animations`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="blockquote" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components} parentName="blockquote">{`This is already implemented in the v14 of the morpher and tools! ðŸŽ‰`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="del" components={components} parentName="p">{`We are working on cross-platform animations in the Views language `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="del" props={{"href":"https://github.com/viewstools/morph/issues/11"}}>{`Contribute here`}</MDXTag>{`)`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="del" components={components} parentName="p">{`Fully custom animations are always possible with Javascript integration of
React Animated, or any in React Web projects transforms and transitions are possible today.`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Reach out with questions via our `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://slack.viewsdx.com/"}}>{`Slack Questions Channel`}</MDXTag>{`.
Mention `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`@tom`}</MDXTag>{` or `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`@dario`}</MDXTag>{` to make sure that we get your notifications.`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
